input: Anne is red. Bob is quiet. Bob is red. Bob is rough. Bob is round. Charlie is kind. Charlie is round. Fiona is big. Fiona is kind. Fiona is nice. Fiona is quiet. Fiona is red. Fiona is rough. Fiona is round. All kind things are rough. If Bob is big then Bob is nice. Red things are kind. Rough things are round. If something is round and rough then it is quiet. Quiet things are kind. If Charlie is kind and Charlie is quiet then Charlie is red. If Bob is rough then Bob is kind. Quiet, rough things are big. Question: Anne is not big.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Anne : obj
constant Bob : obj
constant Charlie : obj
constant Fiona : obj

constant Red : obj → Prop
constant Quiet : obj → Prop
constant Rough : obj → Prop
constant Round : obj → Prop
constant Kind : obj → Prop
constant Big : obj → Prop
constant Nice : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Red Anne
axiom T2 : Quiet Bob
axiom T3 : Red Bob
axiom T4 : Rough Bob
axiom T5 : Round Bob
axiom T6 : Kind Charlie
axiom T7 : Round Charlie
axiom T8 : Big Fiona
axiom T9 : Kind Fiona
axiom T10 : Nice Fiona
axiom T11 : Quiet Fiona
axiom T12 : Red Fiona
axiom T13 : Rough Fiona
axiom T14 : Round Fiona

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x → Rough x
axiom R2 : Big Bob → Nice Bob
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Red x → Kind x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Rough x → Round x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Round x ∧ Rough x → Quiet x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Quiet x → Kind x
axiom R7 : Kind Charlie ∧ Quiet Charlie → Red Charlie
axiom R8 : Rough Bob → Kind Bob
axiom R9 : ∀ x : obj, Quiet x ∧ Rough x → Big x

theorem anne_is_not_big : ¬ Big Anne :=
begin
  intro H,
  have H1 : Kind Anne := R3 Anne T1,
  have H2 : Rough Anne := R1 Anne H1,
  have H3 : Quiet Anne := R5 Anne ⟨H2, R4 Anne H2⟩,
  have H4 : Big Anne := R9 Anne ⟨H3, H2⟩,
  contradiction,
end

-- The answer is True
